Articles.Content: when did you start drinking? im 15, and i have permission(on occasion) and I want to know how lenient your parents are/were to you drinking(if you do, that is).

I almost never drink. Everything but mixed drinks and Baileys taste like urine to me.

My parents didn't really care that much when I was a transfer student in Deutschland.

Since I was born. Don't really see how you can live without drinking!

Your parents would have to be very strict to not allow you to have a cup of water!

[/sarcasm]

about 16

my parents, however, werent 2happy even if other kids have started MUCH earlier (13-14, poland)

with what drink have you started?

14, and usually only on new year's.

I don't particularly like it, but it's in a acquired taste
I'm 22, have never drank alcohol, no desire to start.

38. Aside from socially mandated occasions (e.g. toasts at a wedding, communion at church), I drink no alcohol, and never have. I think it had a lot to do with growing up with a Dad who was a surgeon - there's only so many photographs of bloated livers you can stand.
Since 10, I've been given a glass of champagne every New Year's. It tastes like toilet.

Since 10, I've been given a glass of champagne every New Year's. It tastes like toilet.

you know what a toilet tastes like? wow... but even though i dont know what a toilet taste like, champagne is a nice drink(when available)

I haven't and don't really plan on drinking, I'm 20.

Once I turn 21 I have a plan to go to some land where my family camps and drink as much as I possibly can without risking death/poisoning.

I figure it will make a great story, and I'll regret it enough to prevent me from drinking much ever again.

I'm open to the idea of casual drinking, but as everyone else has said; it tastes like toilet. So I probably won't.

At 14, the first time I drank a beer.

I drinking every weekend alcohol
I started at 17 with vodka im 27 now and I drink Even williams as my whiskey of preference and busch light as my beer I guess im kinda a alchy lol.

I started when i got 16.

My parents gave me two bottles of champagne for my birthday.
The first time I drank (alcohol) was when I was around 22 or 23. I'd just passed my Flight Instructor checkride and my friend came over with Goldschlagger (sp?). Nasty!! I prefer beer now.

Dude Goldschlagger tastes great! I started drinking around 18-19 (start of college). Take it from someone who's been through the "party-phase"...save yourself a lot of embarrassment and pain and DON'T OVER DO IT. There's nothing fun about passing out in your own vomit or while hanging over a dirty toilet seat... That being said, I still drink on occasion. You just have to be particular about where and how much. Lastly...pick a couple favorites from the different categories (Corona is my beer of choice. Jack for whiskey. 1800 Tequila.). It'll save you some nasty experiences and chicks dig a guy who is solid and knows what he wants (if you're female...cooking wine is NOT for drinking). Oh! And gin tastes like armpit, stay away from it.

When I was 14 (25 now)

Christmass day, typical family get together, I asked for a coke please, an was handed Budweiser bottle.

Was drunk by my secound.

Since then I have tried every drink offered to me (experimented with Shorts, champaigns, cocktails, bears, to legal/Non-legal spirits)

Had wildy varying likes/dislikes to combinations of drink.

Favourites been Guinness, Bud, Vodka, Tequilla.

Generally only drink socially, but can go months without any.

Also done some amazingly fun an stupid things while drunk, but life is too enjoy.

see this is the srt of thing im talin about. but you were a light weight!! ive had 5 drinks, not drunk haha. must be genetic, coz my dad and mum can both hold their drink well lol

14, and usually only on new year's.

I don't particularly like it, but it's in a acquired taste

Jeese Timmy, Same age as me, Just started but it is very rare for me, Say if I need inspiration for one of those "What The Hell" rockets

Never have...

Never will...

That's just how I roll...

Edited September 26, 2012 by Whptheenah

Never and i don't plan to start.

EDIT:

okay,okay...Once when i was kid(cca 9 years) i has take small drink from my dad.
14, now at 26 I drink a lot less

Never have, don't really desire to. I mean I tried sips when I lived in Italy and I hated it...so its not really that I'm morally against it - some people don't like grape juice (I also happen to hate grape juice), I just happen to not like alcohol.

When I was 14 (25 now)

Christmass day, typical family get together, I asked for a coke please, an was handed Budweiser bottle.

Was drunk by my secound.

Since then I have tried every drink offered to me (experimented with Shorts, champaigns, cocktails, bears, to legal/Non-legal spirits)

Had wildy varying likes/dislikes to combinations of drink.

Favourites been Guinness, Bud, Vodka, Tequilla.

Generally only drink socially, but can go months without any.

Also done some amazingly fun an stupid things while drunk, but life is too enjoy.

My Gosh, Your Parents Weren't That Responsible When It Came To "Coke please, and was handed a Budweiser bottle" I'm Shocked That They Did That.

I first drank alcohol when I was about 3... my older brother and his friends used to give me little bits of beer to drink at parties and stuff.

When I was 16 I started drinking properly... Got a little too drunk a number of times and quit when I was 19, and managed to stay off it for 3 years. I decided to start again a year ago because I do genuinely enjoy drinking for the taste (I've even recently got into Whisky), and I just try to make sure each time that I don't drink too much.

I have gotten blackout drunk a couple of times in the last year, but it's been a lot better than when I was a teenager. Hopefully I will never get too drunk again... but there's always a risk I guess.

I don't like the taste of any alcoholic drinks I'm aware of and frankly I think I would way to easily become addicted to being drunk (anything that can take my mind off my actual life is something that I would do all the time) so I don't drink.
